indicator_name: Proportion of countries where the legal framework (including customary law) guarantees women’s equal rights to land ownership and/or control
target: Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws
source_url_text_2: Fifth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution
title: Untitled
page_content:
**Revised indicator:** Revised to local context from original text: “Proportion of countries where the legal framework
(including customary law) guarantees women’s equal rights to land ownership and/or control.”

**Non-Statistical Indicator**

## Relevant Policies

The right to property is protected in the United States by the Fifth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution. Since 1849, California’s constitution has protected women’s rights not only to property acquired prior to marriage but to property acquired independently after marriage.
